item.title: Michael K Williams: The Wire star remembered as 'a fine man and a rare talent'
item.description: Tributes are paid to Michael K Williams, best known for the HBO series, who has died at the age of 54.

item.title: BBC's director of news Fran Unsworth to leave the corporation
item.description: Fran Unsworth, who oversees all news and current affairs output, will leave at the start of 2022.

item.title: Baby Queen: Meet pop's boldest, sharpest new voice
item.description: "I have a problem releasing music that doesn't feel significant," says Bella Latham, aka Baby Queen.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses star John Challis cancels tour due to ill health
item.description: Herefordshire actor John Challis' tour is cancelled due to ill health, promoters say.

item.title: Netflix to continue with BBFC age ratings after successful trial
item.description: The streaming giant and the regulator will work together long term after a successful trial.

item.title: Muppets creator Jim Henson's Hampstead home given blue plaque
item.description: The plaque is on the Hampstead house where Jim Henson lived for more than a decade.

item.title: French film great Jean-Paul Belmondo dies at 88
item.description: Star of Breathless, Jean-Paul Belmondo was one of France's most popular actors.

item.title: Kim Kardashian crypto ad singled out by financial watchdog
item.description: An Instagram ad by the influencer was criticised in a speech by FCA chairman Charles Randell.

item.title: Nicole Scherzinger sued by Pussycat Dolls founder Robin Antin
item.description: The group's creator Robin Antin alleges the singer is now refusing to take part in a reunion tour.

item.title: Sarah Harding: Cheryl and Girls Aloud bandmates lead tributes to singer
item.description: Cheryl, Nicola, Kimberley and Nadine lead tributes to their bandmate, who died from cancer aged 39.

item.title: Jewellery ad starring trans model wins hearts in India
item.description: The ad is being praised in India where popular culture still portrays transgender people as caricatures.

item.title: Shang-Chi: Marvel epic tops box office to question release strategy
item.description: Marvel's Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings raises release strategy questions at box office.

item.title: Rapper Wiley charged with east London assault and burglary
item.description: Wiley is accused of assault by beating and burglary with intent to cause criminal damage.

item.title: Dune: Critics largely lavish praise on epic sci-fi remake
item.description: The blockbuster had its world premiere at the Venice International Film Festival over the weekend.

item.title: Jane Birkin: Singer and actress recovering from stroke
item.description: The former muse of Serge Gainsbourg cancels her appearance at a film festival in France.

item.title: Sarah Harding: She was always going at 100mph
item.description: The team behind Girls Aloud's biggest hits remember Sarah Harding who's died at the age of 39.

item.title: 'An irrepressible and immensely likeable pop star'
item.description: The late singer was an irrepressible and immensely likeable pop star with a "wild child" reputation.

item.title: Girls Aloud singer Sarah Harding - her life in pictures
item.description: From Popstars: The Rivals to chart-topping, award-winning success and a Celebrity Big Brother win.

item.title: 'Abba saved 2021' - why the Swedish band have not gone out of fashion
item.description: Forty years after their last album, a new generation of fans is hungry for the pop legends' music.

item.title: Shang-Chi: Why the MCU's first Asian superhero is empowering change
item.description: Shang-Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings sees Simu Liu front an Asian-led cast. Why does it matter?

item.title: Do Abba's new songs live up to their hits?
item.description: The band have released their first new music since 1982 - but is it a hit or a miss?

item.title: Bristol's Love Saves the Day and Idles attracts crowds of 60,000
item.description: Bristol's Team Love describe the past 18 months as they plan for 60k people on The Downs this weekend.

item.title: Sarah Harding dies: The Girls Aloud icon's life in video
item.description: The singer, who announced she had breast cancer in August 2020, has died at the age of 39.

item.title: Hilary Mantel compares Wolf Hall's Thomas Cromwell to modern political figures
item.description: Wolf Hall author Hilary Mantel says modern political figures don't match up to past ones.

item.title: Abba on recording new album Voyage and virtual concerts in London
item.description: The Swedish group unveil their first new music in almost 40 years and shows in London from May 2022.

item.title: Piers Morgan speaks after Ofcom clears ITV over Meghan comments
item.description: Piers Morgan has spoken out after Ofcom cleared ITV over his criticism of Meghan Markle on Good Morning Britain.

item.title: Daniel Mays: Anthony Hopkins 'way off the mark' about drama schools
item.description: Actor Daniel Mays says he "wholeheartedly" disagrees with Anthony Hopkins’ views on drama schools.

item.title: Covid shielder gets private opera performance in back garden
item.description: Ceinwen Giles is shielding from Covid due to her cancer treatment, so an opera was brought to her garden.
